page.title: 19The Church, North Boarhunt
page.content: {St. Nicholas' Church}in Boarhunt is extremely picturesque. The church itself is surrounded by graves, the oldest being closest to the church, the newer ones situated to the east of the church. In the graveyard is a very large yew tree which was probably planted when the church was built. The church has a{North door {'Devil's Door'}that is now bricked up as is the South door. It has a small belfry. The walls are built with flint and the roof is tiled but the North wall has been faced. A wooden arch and gate leads to the church. This church is unusual as it is not linked to a village, but has the Manor Farm adjacent to it.
